Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2014 10:15PM Suesinstitches wrote: So sorry to hear your news.  {{{{{hugs}}}}}
Posts.Title: Age and breast cancer pjc71 del4

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2014 03:08AM Suesinstitches wrote: Thanks sbetts. I had my excisional biopsy today and because of the 4th of July holiday, need to wait extra time for the results.  Somehow I seem to get stuck waiting over holidays.  First Memorial Day now the fourth!  I can't sleep well tonight after sleeping most of the day after the pain meds I had.  It's going to be a very long night. Prior to the surgery, I'd been obsessively feeling for the lump that was not seen on the mamo but the mri picked up,  I think in the last few days I've been able to feel it,  is it possible for it to grow that fast over a few months?  This next week is going to be soooo long,  As well as tonight.
Posts.Title: Just when I think I'm good to go.... Suesinstitches Suesinstitches

Posts.Content: May 26, 2014 06:34PM Suesinstitches wrote: It's hard to believe I've been at this for a month now with no definite answers.  That will end if the BS does a surgical biopsy.  Hopefully this week.  As far as dr google, I've just been trying to educate myself, reading mostly nih and university papers.  I finally figured out how to look at the images on my disks though I don't pretend to know how to interpret them.  So many questions, like why do I have all these fibroadenomas popping up when I'm well past menopause?  Seems like they should be going away.  I know they don't add up to a hill of beans but still curious.  I know I just need to be patient and keep myself busy.  Easy to say, hard to do as you all well know.  Thanks for your kind responses on this holiday.  After I told folks everything came back good, I just don't feel like telling them maybe not.
Posts.Title: Just when I think I'm good to go.... Suesinstitches Suesinstitches

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2014 12:24PM Suesinstitches wrote: I got the copy of the pathology report.  It finds 'fibrocystic change with focal duct hyperplasia, microcalcifications present' which the radiologist is calling a discordant result.  She told my gyn she may not have sampled the right area.  Not surprising as it was so painful, I'm sure she rushed it.  I'm scheduled to see the breast surgeon tomorrow.  Can anyone tell me what to expect at this visit?  Is it likely to just be a discussion of the findings so far?  An exam?  More imaging?  My guess is not the surgical biopsy, right?  I'm trying to be positive.  Some days it even works.
Posts.Title: Just when I think I'm good to go.... Suesinstitches Suesinstitches
Just when I think I'm good to go.... Suesinstitches Suesinstitches

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2014 07:20PM Suesinstitches wrote: I got the pathology report today and discovered ADH and LCIS were found.   I have a follow up visit with the surgeon next week, but I'm hoping this is the end of my walk with the threat of BC.  I know I'll always have an increased risk of getting the disease so I'll have to be sure to do those mammos, something I haven't been very good at in the past.  I never did find out why the lymph nodes were enlarged. Alfieval, I sure hope you get some answers soon. I can't imagine how difficult that wait must be. Leaf, you've been a wealth of information giving me lots of new things to thinks about. I now feel a special connection since our diagnoses are similar. All of you have helped me get through this difficult time.  Thanks for all your kind words ladies.
Posts.Title: Just when I think I'm good to go.... Suesinstitches Suesinstitches

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2014 06:32AM Suesinstitches wrote: thank you for posting this.  I will be having the same procedure done later this month.  Hoping for the same outcome!
Posts.Title: Guided wire excisional biopsy: my experience Mamafid WolfsLady

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2014 12:04PM Suesinstitches wrote: I saw my surgeon for a follow up visit today and she is referring me to an oncologist so I guess she's a proponent of Tamoxifen or one of the other estrogen blocking drugs.  I was hoping to be done with this today.  Additionally, I have a seroma which is a buildup of fluid at the incision site.  Also she wants me to do an mri alternating with mammogram every six months.  This is the same doc who said my initial mri was overimaging.   This topic heading seems to prove itself over and over.
Posts.Title: Just when I think I'm good to go.... Suesinstitches Suesinstitches

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2014 01:15PM Suesinstitches wrote: Well, I finally have a date for the excisional biopsy - July 2.  Talk about taking forever.  When I talked with the BS, she said, "Well, this is a classic case of over-imaging!"  Later, when I asked if I should even be doing the surgery, she said something like "this Pandora's box has been opened so now we have to find out what it is."  Sheesh, I really feel like I should just cancel the whole thing.  She obviously thinks this is nothing so why am I going through this?  Why does the radiologist think it's such a big deal and the BS doesn't.   I really don't know what I should be doing and these mixed messages are really confusing me!
Posts.Title: Just when I think I'm good to go.... Suesinstitches Suesinstitches

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2014 09:55PM Suesinstitches wrote: The lymph nodes were swollen before any biopsies.  But from what I've read online (I know, Kicks), that really doesn't mean much.  I've had wayyyy too much time to "research".  I can easily convince myself it's benign then the next day fear the worst.  I just can't wait to get this, for better or for worse, behind me.  My family and friends are sick of me mentioning it so I just keep my fears to myself now.
Posts.Title: Just when I think I'm good to go.... Suesinstitches Suesinstitches

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2014 05:00PM Suesinstitches wrote: The surgeon called with my results today.  Unfortunately it was while I was in the shower!  So I called back and talked to someone in the office, not the doc, who said my results were benign fibrocystic changes.  This is what the core biopsy had said too.  Later, I checked the online site that's supposed to have the pathology report.  I didn't see a report but a new list of problems: Date Problem Type --------------------------------------------------------- 7/2/2014 12:01:00 AM ABNORMAL MAMMOGRAM NOS Unknown   7/2/2014 12:01:00 AM BREAST FIBROSCLEROSIS Unknown 7/2/2014 12:01:00 AM BREAST CA IN SITU Unknown 7/2/2014 12:01:00 AM BEN MAMMARY DYSPLAS NEC Unknown   What?!  There was no mention of a cancer in situ.  I have a followup appt with the surgeon next week so hope to get some answers then.  The only thing I can think is it must be LCIS which is not a cancer.   The waiting game for answers continues.....
Posts.Title: Just when I think I'm good to go.... Suesinstitches Suesinstitches
